intro: Phyllanthus silheticus, commonly known as the silheti phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rough, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and along stream banks. It has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
